intro: Elateriopsis, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers and silver-gray foliage. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to salty, well-drained soils. Elateriopsis species are often found in Mediterranean regions and along the coasts of southern Europe and North Africa. The flowers are often used in ornamental gardening due to their unique appearance and hardiness.
